channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: This painting is missing. Do you have it?
item.description: An important work from a rediscovered artist has been absent from public view since the 1970s. A New York curator is hunting for it.
item.content:encoded: An important work from a rediscovered artist has been absent from public view since the 1970s. A New York curator is hunting for it.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Vanasco

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: P-A-R-T-Y words and names
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with Mark Karp of Marlboro Township, N.J., and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with Mark Karp of Marlboro Township, N.J., and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, sex goddess of cinema, has died
item.description: Legendary screen siren and animal rights activist Brigitte Bardot has died at age 91. The alluring former model starred in numerous movies, often playing the highly sexualized love interest.
item.content:encoded:
Legendary screen siren and animal rights activist Brigitte Bardot has died at age 91. The alluring former model starred in numerous movies, often playing the highly sexualized love interest.

(Image credit: Keystone Features)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: 'It's behind you!' How Britain goes wild for pantomimes during the holidays
item.description: Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.
item.content:encoded:
Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.

(Image credit: Ella Carmen Dale)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: Kennedy Center vows to sue musician who canceled performance over Trump name change
item.description: The Kennedy Center is planning legal action after jazz musician Chuck Redd canceled an annual holiday concert. Redd pulled out after President Trump's name appeared on the building.
item.content:encoded:
The Kennedy Center is planning legal action after jazz musician Chuck Redd canceled an annual holiday concert. Redd pulled out after President Trump's name appeared on the building.

(Image credit: ‎)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for December 27, 2025: Season's greetings from Wait Wait!
item.description: This week, we open our presents, which include visits from Bob Costas, a trip back to Hawaii, and more!
item.content:encoded:
This week, we open our presents, which include visits from Bob Costas, a trip back to Hawaii, and more!

(Image credit: Sean M. Haffey)

item.title: Perry Bamonte, guitarist and keyboardist for The Cure, dies at 65
item.description: Perry Archangelo Bamonte, longtime guitarist and keyboardist for the influential goth band The Cure, has died. He was 65. The band announced his death on their official website on Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Perry Archangelo Bamonte, longtime guitarist and keyboardist for the influential goth band The Cure, has died. He was 65. The band announced his death on their official website on Friday.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: NPR's 'Code Switch': Joy as Resistance
item.description: Leah Donnella of NPR's Code Switch has spent some time unpacking what it would mean for joy to be used as a means of resistance.
item.content:encoded: Leah Donnella of NPR's Code Switch has spent some time unpacking what it would mean for joy to be used as a means of resistance.
item.dc:creator: Leah Donnella

item.title: 'The Rest of Our Lives' takes readers on a midlife crisis road trip
item.description: America's literary highways may be plenty crowded with middle-aged runaways fleeing lives that increasingly feel like a bad fit. But Ben Markovits adds a moving tale to the collection.
item.content:encoded: America's literary highways may be plenty crowded with middle-aged runaways fleeing lives that increasingly feel like a bad fit. But Ben Markovits adds a moving tale to the collection.
item.dc:creator: Heller McAlpin

item.title: Hunker down with these 13 mysteries and thrillers from 2025
item.description: Mysteries and thrillers are enjoyable no matter the season, but there's something extra satisfying about curling up in the winter with a warm drink and an all-engrossing read. Here's what we suggest.
item.content:encoded: Mysteries and thrillers are enjoyable no matter the season, but there's something extra satisfying about curling up in the winter with a warm drink and an all-engrossing read. Here's what we suggest.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck
